result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrelle Adkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

- All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, to convert to a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrelle Adkins

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terrelle Adkins in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
*
Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges with credit for 1 day time served.
Court stayed the sentence and placed defendant on 10 months probation.
Conditions of probation are:
standard conditions of probation to include:
- no possession of firearms
- 15 hours of community service as determined by the PO agent

Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample by 8/19/2022 and pay the DNA surcharges.

All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, to convert to a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Terrelle Adkins in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for deferred prosecution agreement hearing. Defense requested additional time to review. Court ordered case adjourned for deferred prosecution agreement and plea/sentencing hearing in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Terrelle Adkins in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Terrelle Adkins appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast. Defense is in resolution posture.  Defendant to be TAD evaluated.   DPA Hearing scheduled in Branch 37.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Terrelle Adkins in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Terrelle Adkins in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/24/22 @ 2:30p
